Explanations:
Bioverita: This variety is an organic, newly bred, variety. It has been cultivated from the very outset in organic conditions, to best adapt to organic cultivation. Varieties that carry the Bioverita label are reproducible and fertile, and aim to offer an alternative to hybrid-seeds to professional gardeners.
Primed seeds: During priming, the germination process is activated for faster and more uniform emergence. The priming effect is only maintained for a few weeks. This seed should be stored cool (approx. 5°C), dry and dark. The primed seeds in our range are primed using a biocompatible technique.
Name: ATHOS
Description:
KS
  se52
Pale-skinned celeriac with pronounced flavour. Highly resistant to bolting so suitable for early as well as normal cultivation. Tightly-knit, narrow root system facilitates harvesting and cleaning. For making bunches, selling fresh and storage. Variety bred by Sativa.
Type: white celeriac

Explanations: ProSpecieRara: This variety has been awarded by ProSpecieRara as a rare or old variety. ProSpecieRara is a foundation dedicated to preserving the diversity of rare plant varieties. In long-term cooperation with ProSpecieRara, Sativa is active in the important preservation and cultivation of these traditional varieties.
Name: BERGERS
Description:
WEISSE KUGEL
 se11
Old and robust variety with a strong and characteristic taste taste of celeriac. The medium-sized tubers have a smooth, rather dark skin. Strong foliage, upright and very resistant to septoria. For eating fresh or keeping.
Type: white celeriac

Explanations:
Primed seeds: During priming, the germination process is activated for faster and more uniform emergence. The priming effect is only maintained for a few weeks. This seed should be stored cool (approx. 5°C), dry and dark. The primed seeds in our range are primed using a biocompatible technique.
Conservation Breeding: For this variety Sativa practices conservation breeding in Rheinau. To ensure high-quality varieties, they must be maintained. They are regularly replicated and selected by their positive characteristics. In doing so the varieties are continually improved and adapted to growing conditions.
Name: MONARCH
Description:
se12
Variety which gives large, heavy white bulbs. Ramains white even after cooking. Good for storage. Somewhat susceptible to Septoria leaf spot, but fairly resistant to rust.
Type: white celeriac

Explanations:
Bioverita: This variety is an organic, newly bred, variety. It has been cultivated from the very outset in organic conditions, to best adapt to organic cultivation. Varieties that carry the Bioverita label are reproducible and fertile, and aim to offer an alternative to hybrid-seeds to professional gardeners.
Primed seeds: During priming, the germination process is activated for faster and more uniform emergence. The priming effect is only maintained for a few weeks. This seed should be stored cool (approx. 5°C), dry and dark. The primed seeds in our range are primed using a biocompatible technique.
Name: PORTHOS
Description:
KS
  se54
White-fleshed variety bred by Sativa. Forms large, round and smooth tuber with strong foliage. Small root stock for easier harvest and less cleaning. This variety is bolt-resistant and highly resistant to septoria and has a distinct celeriac flavor.
Type: white celeriac

Name: TALL
Description:
UTAH
se30
Dark-green celery of medium height with excellent taste. High-yielding and robust. Not self-blanching. Time for cultivation outdoors, ca. 2 months. Can be used in the kitchen raw, or cooked in numerous ways.
Type: celery stalks

Explanations: Pelleted seeds (pills). The seeds are coated with mineral fillers. The aim is to standardise size and shape to facilitate (technical) sowing. The biocompatible pills are sold per piece.
Name: NEW
Description:
TANGO
se31
Reliable, medium green blanched celery with long, smooth stems, ideal for the whole season. Highly resistant to bolting and heart rot, few side shoots, ready to harvest approx. 80 days after planting.
Type: celery stalks
